squats_feedback.right: Depth and stance: The segment emphasizes proper form regarding reaching parallel depth and adjusting stance for comfort and effectiveness.
squats_feedback.wrong: Upper body falling forward, heels lifting, and lower back rounding.
squats_feedback.correction: For the upper body falling forward, focus on keeping the chest up and maintaining a neutral spine. For heels lifting, ensure your weight is on your heels and try elevating them onto weight plates if ankle mobility is an issue. For lower back rounding, engage your core and avoid going too deep if mobility is limited.

squats_feedback.right: Proper ascent techniques including rising chest and hips at the same rate, proper knee alignment, glute engagement, and correct breathing technique.
squats_feedback.wrong: Hips rising faster than the chest, which puts pressure on the lower back.
squats_feedback.correction: To fix hips rising faster than the chest, focus on driving the chest and hips up at the same rate by pushing the floor away and driving your traps up against the bar. Engage your core throughout the movement to maintain stability.
